name: Next-Gen Solar PV

image.attribution: Stanford ENERGY, Video by Mark Shwartz (CC BY 2.5)

description: III-V Semiconductors solar panels and perovskite-based panels

outcomes.text: Smart devices like Alexa from the mid 2000's are all powered by the excess light produced in homes and buildings absorbed by the ubiquitous perovskite-silicon tandem solar cells.

name: Mass Carbon Capture
description: Mandate installation of point-source carbon capture equipment on all fossil-burning power plants for storage underground.

outcomes.text: We were able to reduce emissions somewhat, but leaks and upstream emissions limited the overall amount.

name: Rewilding
description: Repopulate wildlife by scaling back agricultural and industrial land use while actively reseeding and reintroducing endemic wildlife.

outcomes.text: With scaled back farming, the quality of life has increased for rural America, though the prices for agricultural products had to increase.
Reindeer in the Arctic are thriving and have increased soil carbon sequestration.
The resilience of nature never ceases to surprise.

name: Space Colony
description: Establish off-world colonies.

outcomes.text: Robotic probes have explored Europa and have discovered life-like forms. Further study is needed.

name: Esperanto
description: Introduce a universal language

outcomes.text: Lernu la anglan se vi volas gajni monon; lernu Esperanton se vi volas amikiĝi.
You are formally invited to the yearly gathering of Esperantists.

name: Land Protection
description: Place large amounts of habitable land under protection to preserve biodiversity.

name: Green Hydrogen
description: Invest in the development of and infrastructure for zero-carbon hydrogen fuel generation.

outcomes.text: Research and development improved electrolysis efficiency and built infrastructure. Hydrogen fuel can now be produced and transported on a mass scale without emissions.

name: Cellular Meat
description: Cell-based meat or "craft meat" is in the news, but will it be as popular as meat?

outcomes.text: Eccentric individuals are pining for the cell based meat of extinct animals, it is sort of an eco-conscious delicacy.
Advancements in this technology are highly useful for organ growing in the medical field. We can now sucessfully grow new organs for people and people are living longer!
We were able to lower the cost per unit, but not anywhere near as low as the meat industry subsidies.

name: Closed Borders
description: Maintain closed borders across regions to manage migrations.

name: Soil Fertility AI
description: AI technique with IoT features to measure pH level, temperature, Moisture content and NPK(nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium)  to help to evaluate and manage soil fertility.

name: Reruralization
description: Launch a program to incentivize people to move out of the cities and into the countrysides

outcomes.text: A cooperative is formed in which citizens can participate by becoming farmland shareholders.

name: Mass Electrification
description: Mass electrify services and devices that typically do not use electricity.

name: Gadgets, Fast Fashion, and Endless TV
description: Improve morale the easy way.

name: Drought-Resistant Crops
description: Develop new more drought-resistant varieties and encourage the adoption of existing drought-resistant crops.

outcomes.text: Maize harvests in African countries have increased by 20% percent.

name: Half-Earth
description: Put a significant amount of habitable land under protection and rewild to preserve biodiversity.

outcomes.text: Wildlife populations are thriving and have increased soil carbon sequestration.

name: Direct Air Capture
description: Install DAC units to take CO2 out of the atmosphere.

outcomes.text: New plastics and cement are created using captured carbon.

name: Food Waste Campaign
description: Begin a campaign to address food waste across all parts of the food system.

outcomes.text: The processing of biomaterials made from food waste such as crichton from crab shells is streamlined for large scale production.

name: Carbon-Negative Concrete
description: Scale up carbon-negative concrete production processes.

outcomes.text: New carbon tech startups like Ecocrete, CleanBuild, and Solid Negative Solutions have all received multiple rounds of funding and Ecocrete is expected to go public soon.

name: High-Density Batteries
description: Develop higher-density alternatives to existing batteries, expanding where they can be used.

outcomes.text: An all electric aircraft for commercial use is now a reality, no more flight shaming.

name: Vegan Campaign
description: A long-term public messaging campaign to encourage a transition to veganism.

outcomes.text: In Japan, people have turned the remaining surplus meat products into a Yokai, forever haunting the now vegan locals.

name: Expand Recycling
description: Expand recycling infrastructure to rural and undeveloped areas and implement research and development initiatives in electronics recycling and plasma gasification.

outcomes.text: The elderly have taken a liking to overseeing local recycling drop off facilities, making sure people put the correct recyclables in the right bin.
A new global recycling program helped keep plastic out of the ocean, as well as other ecosystems. It also made the world a bit nicer to live in for humans.

name: Expand Public Transit
description: A global effort to develop new comprehensive public transit networks and upgrade ailing existing networks.

outcomes.text: Car-loving citizens in the global North have aggressively resisted this initiative.
Communities affected most by highway infrastructure are experiencing less air pollution and increased health.

name: Factory Farming Reform

image.attribution: "Undercover Investigation at Manitoba Pork Factory Farm" by Mercy For Animals Canada is licensed under CC BY 2.0.

description: Slaughterhouses are still brutal, but for now the kill lines will be slower and some of the worst practices have been banned, such as de-beaking, tail docking, and horn bud burning, as well as feeding animals feces, carcasses, candy, and garbage.

outcomes.text: Some people will have their conscience soothed, others will be annoyed at having less meat because production is less efficient, while others will demand more radical change.

name: Agricultural robotics
description: Increasing production yields for farmers using robots to reduce human labor for tasks like spraying and weeding, crop harvesting, seeding and planting, soil analysis, and livestock feeding.

outcomes.text: The use of agricultural robots means more can be produced, but they are only cost effective if they are working a large enough plot of land. We need to increase the amount of land allotted for agriculture and farming.

name: Nuclear Fusion
description: Ongoing research into nuclear fusion.

outcomes.text: Success!
Failed, it doesn't work

name: Ocean Iron Fertilization
description: Introduce iron into the oceans to stimulate phytoplankton growth and increase carbon sequestration.

outcomes.text: The experiment succeeded in drawing down carbon from the atmosphere, but it had an uninteded side-effect: the decomposition of plankton formed anoxic dead zones on the abyssal plains.
The new abundance of phytoplankton catalyzed a resurgence of whale populations, who helped to sequester carbon from the surface down to the seafloor sediments.
For a short time, the surface waters bloomed, but there was no mechanism to transport it to the deep...

name: Mass Demilitarization
description: Begin global program to destroy weapons and scale down military and police budgets around the world.

outcomes.text: Demilitarization resulted in a significant drop in global emissions, as well as an increase in global outlook and untold tons of salvagable metals.

name: Champagne Socialism
description: Make champagne an everyday luxury. Bread and roses are nice, but a bit of bubbly is good for morale too.

name: Accelerate Development
description: Rapidly increase development throughout the world to catch up to Global North levels.

name: Degrowth in Developed Regions
description: Reduce the development level of wealthy regions. Consumption impacts will be lowered, though quality of life may not decrease by much.

outcomes.text: Some people are having a hard time transitioning into the 15 hr work week.

name: Restrictions on Air Travel
description: Limit air travel to only long-haul trips that can't be accomplished by train.

outcomes.text: Space previously used for airports has now opened up.

name: Co-Generation
description: Install co-generation systems in eligible structures and power facilities to generate electricity and heat at the same time, making use of otherwise wasted heat.

outcomes.text: We've achieved greater energy independence by moving a portion of the load off the grid.

name: Energy Quotas
description: Limit per-capita energy consumption to a level supportive of a good quality of life, though perhaps far lower than wealthier regions are used to.

name: De-extinction Initiative
description: Attempt to restore some of the planet's lost biodiversity.

outcomes.text: Using the same technology, the designer dog market has exploded.
We were able to bring back the passenger pigeon, but this quickly became an exotic poultry dish leading to its extinction again.
We succeeded in cloning some lost species and successfully re-introduced them into their original ecosystems.
We succeeded in cloning some lost species, but they all were either short-lived or could not survive in the wild.

name: Cloud Brightening
description: Inject particles into clouds to reflect more sunlight, reducing global temperatures.

outcomes.text: The presence of aerosol particles promotes cloud thinning, reducing the amount of water in the cloud, letting more solar radiation pass through. The temporary cooling has reversed.

name: Biofabrication
description: Production of products from raw materials such as living cells, biomaterials, and molecules. Able to produce materials traditionally composed of animal based products or petroleum based products.

outcomes.text: Precision fermentation has been the most sucessful method used in biofabrication of packaging and flavor and fragrances.
Petroleum based plastic is no longer being produced.

name: Asteroid Mining
description: Build out infrastructure to mine, process, and transport minerals from asteroids.

outcomes.text: After capturing the Davida asteroid and steering it within Earth orbit, lithium and rare earth metals became abundant and many evironmentally-destructive mining practices became obsolete..

name: Phase Out Commercial Fishing
description: End subsidies for commercial seafood extraction and implement transition programs for workers in the fishing sector.

outcomes.text: The hairy-nosed otter (Lutra sumatrana) has been seen again! Now a popular manga mascot, the rare otter represents hope and honor.
The health of ancient corals is improving, providing protection from destructive storm surges waves.
The people are angry. They want their fresh local swordfish, tuna, lobster and crabmeat!

name: Electric-Arc Furnaces
description: Improved efficiency compared to a blast furnace. Allows steel to be made from 100% scrap material rather than virgin steelmaking from ores, which is less energy intensive.

outcomes.text: We've improved efficiency and lowered emissions with this method but because it relies so heavily on unwanted and unused material, resources are limited, production time and output is stalled.

name: Orbital Mirror Array
description: Reflective satellites to deflect the amount of solar radiation that impacts the Earth.

outcomes.text: The technology is now used to reflect heat on Mars, conditions on mars are now suitable for human colonists.

name: Battery Storage Network
description: Build out battery storage capacity and transmission to resolve intermittency and electricity supply issues.

outcomes.text: Keppel Offshore & Marine and the Singapore Energy Market Authority has successfully developed a floating 7.5 MWh energy storage system, increasing the efficiency of the systems deployment.

name: Space Elevator
description: Reduces need for fuel-intensive transport for the space industry.

outcomes.text: The elevators have increased in size, lowering the cost, inciting a planet grabbing fury.

name: Hydrogen Steel
description: Use hydrogen instead of fossil fuel for refining and transforming steel.

outcomes.text: Green hydrogen allowed the steel manufacturing sector to be fully decarbonized, but it requires a lot more energy.
The fossil fuel required to produce the hydrogen effectively offset the advantage of not burning it at the steel plant.

name: Meatless Mondays
description: One day a week people will abstain from eating meat, which will reduce demand accordingly. This will reduce pressure on ecosystems and greenhouse gas emissions.

name: Veganism Mandate
description: Implement a ban on all animal products, effective immediately.

outcomes.text: Pro-Livestock activists take to the streets.

name: Ban on Outdoor Cats

image.attribution: "The Great Duck Hunt, part II" by Eirik Newth is licensed under CC BY-SA 2.0

description: Cats kill 1.3-4 billion birds in US alone. It is estimated that cats have contributed to 14% of bird, mammal, and reptile extinctions.

name: Stop Food Aid

image.attribution: "Drought in Africa: Ethiopia" by United Nations Photo is licensed under CC BY-NC 2.0

description: This policy will reduce population by halting food aid to famished regions. Mortality will go up significantly.

name: Wood Skyscrapers
description: Implement an initiative to store carbon captured by trees in human structures.

outcomes.text: Significant amounts of carbon was locked into human structures and wide-scale refirestation helped to buffer the ecological strain of increased logging.
Significant amounts of carbon was locked into human structures, but the increase in logging put a serious strain on forest ecosystems.

name: 3rd Generation Biofuels
description: Develop improved and scalable algae biofuel production processes.

outcomes.text: A genetically altered strain of Nannochloropsis is able to produce a higher concentration of lipids for biofuel and butanol.
We can now grow and deploy algae-based biofuels at scale.

name: Solar Radiation Management
description: Launch aerosols into the air to blot out the sun.

outcomes.text: There as been an increase in acid rain.
Some areas have experienced cooling, but without significant emissions abatement, SRM needs to be ramped up to keep pace.

name: Counterterrorism Forces
description: A specially-trained force to manage terrorists and other smaller insurgent reactionary threats.

name: Deep Sea Mining

image.attribution: NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration and Research (Public Domain)

description: Permit deep sea mining to open up vast new mineral resources, but at high risk to marine ecosystems.

name: Total Ban on Cars
description: Ban private vehicles first in urban areas then everywhere. Tear up highways and transform cites, while saving lives, fuel and steel. This is a hard policy to push through, but the gains are immense.

outcomes.text: There has been a rapid decline in mortality from diabetes and coronary heart disease, let alone fatalities from car accidents (1.35 million per year)

name: Passive House Program Mandate
description: Implement guidelines for all new construction to use little energy thanks to improvements in insulation, clever design, and energy-production.

name: Indigenous Land Management
description: Accelerate the transfer of ancestral lands back to their historical stewards.

outcomes.text: Reduced deforestation has resulted in 12.9 gigatons of carbon dioxide emissions avoided.

name: The Ark
description: Biodiversity has been plummeting, and people fear that most of earth's species will be lost forever. This project is an effort to collect and store DNA samples of earth's remaining biodiversity in case the worst should come to pass.

outcomes.text: We had collected most of our samples but then a massive blackout spoiled everything...
We were able to successfully develop the Ark and collect samples of a majority of the remaining species.

name: Breeder Reactor
description: Research and develop nuclear reactors that run on spent uranium and generates more fissile material than it consumes

outcomes.text: We can now deploy fast-breeder reactors, which will help alleviate uranium shortages by burning spent nuclear waste.
We were never able to overcome the reprocessing and fuel fabrication balance challenges. It's time to throw in the towel.

name: One-Child Policy
description: Mandate that no family can have more than one child.

outcomes.text: There are too many people living into seniority and not enough facilities to take care of them!
The gender ratio has shifted as people prefer to have girls rather than boys.

name: Mission to Titan
description: Titan has an abundance of liquid hydrocarbons, more than even Earth. We could go get it...but why?

outcomes.text: Boom in the plastics industry.

name: Orbital Space Settlements
description: Develop permanent near-orbit space habitation, providing a waystation and home base for further space activities.

outcomes.text: The initiative is sucessful for select members of society. The thing they enjoy most about living in orbit is that solar power is available 24/7, which means there is no night and they never have to go to sleep.

name: Traditional animal husbandry mandate
description: Ban industrial animal farming.

outcomes.text: Citizens are pleased with the cleaner air and water, but it has proven difficult to meet demand for animal products using only traditional animal husbandry.

name: Relocate Industry to Space
description: Mine resources to build infrastructure in space, harvesting fuel and beaming solar energy back to Earth.

outcomes.text: While many more jobs were created, Bezos is crushing the space mining unions from forming..
Space mining employs those who were out of work when we switched to solar beaming tech.

name: Biosphere 3
description: Closed-system ecologies will be necessary if we want to explore deeper into space. Or if the outside world becomes uninhabitable.

outcomes.text: Our experiments were beset by disaster upon disaster. We weren't able to create a fully closed ecology. But we learned a lot!
We managed to create a self-sustaining environment--a necessary step for manned space exploration.

name: Vegetarian Mandate
description: Implement a ban on all meat products, effective immediately.

name: Development Limits
description: Prevent poorer regions of the world from developing further, keeping their material footprints low.

name: Thorium Reactor
description: Develop scalable and safe thorium reactors.

outcomes.text: We can now deploy thorium reactors, which use a far more abundant fuel and create far less radioactive waste.

name: Antarctic Pumping
description: Pump water from the ocean onto Antarctica to reduce melting rates.

outcomes.text: The water has flowed back into the ocean — and at an accelerated rate.
All of the pipelines, pump stations, and wind farms have caused significant ecological disruption.

name: SUV and Truck Ban
description: Immediate ban on the largest and most-polluting vehicles.

name: Land Expansion
description: Creating more built environments to house urban populations and their activities.

outcomes.text: We need to reduce cropland. How we account for the loss in agricultural production? We'll figure it out later.

name: Electrify Road Vehicles
description: Phase out combustion cars and mandate a transition to electric-motored vehicles.

outcomes.text: Copper, a metal used in electric vehicle components and charging infrastructure is also needed for power grids, solar PV plants, and wind turbines. We're running out.

Electrifying automobiles significantly decreased transport emissions and did wonders for urban air pollution, but at a high cost in electricity and lithium, without doing anything to improve transportation access or traffic deaths.

name: Hempcrete
description: Scale up concrete production from hemp, locking carbon in building materials.

outcomes.text: It locked in a fair amount of carbon, but it wasn't strong enough to fully replace conventional concrete...

name: Energy Conservation Campaign

image.attribution: Department of Defense. American Forces Information Service. Defense Visual Information Center. 1994 (Public Domain)

description: Start a campaign to encourage energy conservation and low-energy lifestyles.

outcomes.text: Young people are not responsive to the campaign. They do not feel personal behavior is the driving force of climate change and are suspicious of campaigns coming from Big Energy to deflect responsibility.

name: Mini Nuclear Reactor
description: Scaled down versions of full-sized nuclear reactors. Dramatically higher output than wind power.  Lower capital start-up costs and less time to build.

outcomes.text: Mini reactors are turning out to be more expensive than we thought, and taking longer to develop.

name: Alternative Refrigerants
description: Gradual replacement of hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs) with alternative refrigerants like ammonia, carbon dioxide, propane, and isobutane that have a significantly lower global warming potential.

outcomes.text: R-744 (Carbon dioxide, CO2) as the chosen natural refrigerant has lower efficiency.

name: Universal Abortions & Contraceptives
description: Mandate that abortions, contraceptives, and other family planning services are universally accessible to whomever needs them.

name: Phytomining
description: A method of extracting metals from a group of plants which are hyperaccumulators of gold, silver, lead or nickle. The plants absorb metal ions through their roots, removing toxic metals from contaminated soil – like around old mines. Improves the speed of remediation and reclamation initiatives.

outcomes.text: Smallholding farmers are able to grow on metal-rich soils, clean up former mine waste and collect some revenue.

name: Cap and Trade Program for Children
De-extinction
description: Improved cloning techniques that would allow for the revival of extinct species.

outcomes.text: There is increased support from farmers hoping for the technology's application to commercial breeding of livestock.
The religious scientific community is making great strides to recreate the exact species that would have been on Noah's ark.

name: Ban on Non-Indigneous Hunting

image.attribution: Ray Bird / Berkeley Hunt & Beaufort Hunt, Joint Meet, nr Kingscote, Gloucestershire 1988 / CC BY-SA 2.0

description: Hunting often reduces animal populations between 60-80 per cent. Seven per cent of all mammals are threatened with extinction because of hunting, 26 per cent of threatened mammals are endangered by hunting. Hunting is an important driver of the Sixth Extinction, but still secondary to land-use change caused by the livestock industry.

name: Floating Wind Turbines
description: Iron out some remaining technical issues for less complicated floating wind turbine installation and maintenance.

outcomes.text: Storms and hurricanes are damaging the turbines, they need constant repair. It's getting expensive!

name: Marine Protected Areas
description: Significantly expand the area of no-take marine reserves.

outcomes.text: More cetaceans and pinnipeds have been spotted!

name: Cloud Seeding
description: Research a way to seed clouds to induce rain, helping to prevent crop failures.

outcomes.text: The temporary effect of increased snowfall was great for the ski towns who rely on tourists.
We weren't able to develop any consistent way of seeding clouds.
We managed to develop a fairly reliable method for cloud seeding. This should help prevent drought-induced crop failures.

name: Remediation and Restoration
description: Restore, remediate, and/or reforest any land that has been degraded or otherwise affected by human activity, including peatlands, coastal ecosystems, forests, and more.

outcomes.text: The pollinators have returned!

name: Feed Cattle Seaweed to Slightly Lower Methane Emissions
Long-Range Electric Aviation
description: Figure out ways to decarbonize long-range air travel.

outcomes.text: Development of hydrogen technology led to fuel cell adaptations allowing much lighter electric aircraft.
Weight limitations of lithium batteries limited their ability to carry commercial aircraft long distances.

name: Desalination Plants
description: Expand desalination capacity to supplement dwindling freshwater supplies.

outcomes.text: Reliance on fossil fuels has increased.

Desalination brine is getting pumped back into the ocean. Ocean species are not equipped to adjust to the immediate change in salinity caused by the release of brine into the area. The super-saturated salt water decreases oxygen levels in the water, causing animals and plants to suffocate.

name: Bioenergy Carbon Capture and Sequestration (BECCS)
description: First you grow the plants, then you burn them for power and capture the emissions to store underground. It takes up a lot of land, but it's a way to get negative emissions and power generation.

name: Building Retrofit Program
description: Buildings demand 55% of global electrical production and directly produce 15% of CO2 emissions. We can't tear down and rebuild every building, but new cladding and insulation can make buildings more efficient.

name: Perennial Cereals
description: Perennial versions of the major cereal crops mean they don't need to be replanted each year, disturbing the soil less and sequestering more in deep roots.

outcomes.text: The deeply rooted wheatgrass Kernza (Thinopyrum intermedium) is the first to receive large scale distribution.
